page.title: 07Wave Reflection Wall 2.
page.content: Phases 1 and 2 of the sea wall were constructed between 1982 and 1984 and stretched from Happy Mount Park to the Town Hall. The contractors were Harbour and General Ltd. and the 2 phases cost Â£931,300, 6 men were employed on site. Concrete was supplied by a Ready Mix concrete supplier. The wall was built on the promenade side of the existing wall and is designed as a secondary line of defence. The main sea wall is still the first line. The new wall is described as a wave reflection wall and its job is to turn back the mass of green water that surges unchecked over the main wall. The main wall absorbs the initial energy of the sea. Any water spilling on to the promenade is returned to the sea by the Reflection Wall. the wall is curved to enable this to happen.
